title: Skybox clouds move much too fast if gazebo runs slower than real-time

content.raw:
I just recorded a 27 second (simulation time) bag file in the vrc task 2 world, which took me 2.5 h thanks to gazebo running with a real-time factor of ~0.01. Looking at the recorded camera images, the clouds in the sky move at a extremely high speed, which probably is related to them not being properly slowed down to move in sync with simulation time.
This can be a very serious issue when working with visual odometry algorithms, as suddenly large parts of the image seem to move very fast (when the sky is visible) .
content.html: I just recorded a 27 second (simulation time) bag file in the vrc task 2 world, which took me 2.5 h thanks to gazebo running with a real-time factor of ~0.01. Looking at the recorded camera images, the clouds in the sky move at a extremely high speed, which probably is related to them not being properly slowed down to move in sync with simulation time. This can be a very serious issue when working with visual odometry algorithms, as suddenly large parts of the image seem to move very fast (when the sky is visible) .
